caption:
This photograph captures a serene scene of a wide expanse of a sandy area, likely a dune, under a beautiful sunset sky. The foreground consists of a vast stretch of wavy, wind-sculpted sand that shows distinct ripple patterns, suggesting no recent human or animal activity.

In the middle distance, a hilly dune is decorated by patches of sparse vegetation and a grouping of pine trees which are clustered at the top and the slopes of the dune. The trees appear resilient, adapting to the challenging sandy environment, and contribute to preventing erosion by stabilizing the sand with their root systems.

The entire scenery is bathed in the warm glow of a sunset, creating long shadows that add depth and texture to the landscape. The sky displays gradients of purple and pink hues, reflecting the last light of the day.

Overall, the composition of the photograph, with its untouched natural beauty and the quiet moment just before dusk, evokes a sense of calm and solitude, illustrating the harsh yet beautiful conditions typical of this type of ecosystem.
title: Sand dunes between the town of Florence and the Pacific Ocean. Grass has been planted to stabilize the dunes.
